bug.short_desc: Add "Subcommand" Interface to CLI Tool Commands

long_desc.thetext:
Add a git/svn/hg-like command-line interface to qooxdoo's shell tools, esp. generator.py (but pot. also compile.py, ecmalint.py, ...).
These kind of CLIs are sometime referred to as "subcommand" interfaces. They have a main command (main program) that takes as the first parameter a subcommand that drives the main action. E.g.
git show git log git pull git rebase ...
The individual subcommands can take additional (and varying) arguments, as well as options. The main command might take some global options that can be applied to only the main command / all subcommands collectively, and might have a default subcommand that is executed when none of the known subcommands is provided (often the 'help' subcommand).
I've stumbled upon docopt (http://docopt.org/) recently. May be interesting besides argpase.
